item.title: Light on footpath not working., 7th February
item.description:
The overhead light on the footpath from Broxbourne Road to Eastcote is not working. I’ve only noticed it tonight.

item.title: Chesterfield Grove (opposite the car wash)-Flytipping- 3rd Complaint, 7th February
item.description:
3rd complaint: There are 2 pellats that could fall on pedestrians. 2 chairs dumped (7th complaint) where furniture should be appropriately disposed of. It is completely unacceptable that this is a site for dumping of rubbish and nothing is being done about the removal of them, which will encourage more flytipping.The Duty of Care is not being demonstrated of not abiding by the law in regards to the responsible manner of rubbish disposal/removal. Health and safety of the residents and wider community should be paramount.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25, Chesterfield Grove, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Poor surface around inspection cover - highly dangerous, 6th February
item.description:
Very damaged road surface around a manhole that is worsening by the day - one of six in the south bound direction that present a risk of death or serious injury to road users. This hole is getting the granny smashed out of it by the buses and vehicles hitting it every day. It needs urgent repair. Until it is repaired the local authority must put in place a strictly enforced 20mph limit to protect cyclists having to swerve.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 65, Willersley Avenue, Blackfen, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Fly-tip Small - Less than one bag

item.title: Pothole around 40cm wide and 10cm deep, 6th February
item.description:
I am writing to report a pothole on Kingsland Road, London, specifically outside the properties numbered 321-325 Kingsland Road, postcode E8 4DL. The pothole appears quite deep and deteriorating. It poses a significant hazard to vehicles (risk of tyre damage, loss of control, especially for cyclists and motorbikes) and could cause accidents if not addressed promptly, particularly during wet weather or at night. It causes severe dirt and splashes of gravel on to our window, doors and shutters and leaving the entrance to our business ruined. We are losing customers on a daily basis and have to pay a cleaning firm to come and clean all the time. I believe this requires urgent attention as it is worsening and could lead to injury and further damage. If possible, please prioritise an inspection and repair. For reference: • Location: Kingsland Road, outside 321-325 • Approximate size/depth: around 40cm wide and 10cm deep. • Date observed: 31th of January 2026 • Additional notes: please see attached images and videos Please confirm receipt of this report and provide a reference number if you have a tracking system. I would appreciate any update on when an inspection or repair might take place. Thank you for your prompt attention to this safety issue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 321, Kingsland Road, Haggerston, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
